title: What are the traditional beliefs and scientific investigations behind the concept of the "evil eye" or "jettatura"?
first_phrase: The last part of this text explores various concepts related to the effects of meditation, brain stimulation, and social behavior. It contains references to Vedi Lefebure and Stuart Hameroff's insights, as well as studies on the activation of chewing components and social referencing in children. Additionally, it delves into the notion of the evil eye in other languages and shares an anecdote about Virgilio T.'s use of words and gaze for ill intentions. The part ends with references to Romans and Aethiopica.

In questo continuava quindi la tradizione dei fascinatori narrati da Del Rio (vedi la parte storica all’inizio del libro) che agiscono “carmine prolato”, cioè con una cadenza specifica nella voce. last_phrase: In conclusion, while beliefs in "evil eye" and related concepts may seem superstitious, they have persisted throughout history and in various cultures. Works by scholars and researchers have delved deeper into the psychological and social aspects of these beliefs, shedding light on their complex nature.
